bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 170, Number 61 (Wednesday, April 10, 2024)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. ESPAILLAT:H.R. 7926.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:section 5 of Amendment XIV to the Constitution.The single subject of this legislation is:To amend title 49, United States Code, with respect torequirements for air carriers to disclose certain exposuresto toxic fumes, and for other purposes.[Page H2290]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.

bill.title: Airline Travelers Right to Know Act

item.title: Airline Travelers Right to Know Act
Airline Travelers Right to Know Act
To amend title 49, United States Code, with respect to requirements for air carriers to disclose certain exposures to toxic fumes, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
